H0.text: Heat is the form of energy that plants need to capture in order to perform photosynthesis.

H1.text: Solar energy is the form of energy that plants need to capture in order to perform photosynthesis.

H2.text: Chemical is the form of energy that plants need to capture in order to perform photosynthesis.

H3.text: Electrical is the form of energy that plants need to capture in order to perform photosynthesis.

A4.text: Photosynthesis converts light energy from sunlight into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: The process always begins when light energy is absorbed by the reaction centers, proteins that contain photosynthetic pigments or chromophores.
